You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Set Up the Parent-Child Hierarchy Strategy for Effective Accounts

Grant access for a contact to shop on behalf of all accounts that are child accounts of the contact's account. Set up the appropriate accounts, create the required sharing sets, and update the appropriate storefront configuration settings.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
Edit account details	Edit on Accounts
Create a sharing set	Customize Application
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

For example, maybe a customer manages regional accounts—Acme East and Acme West—that roll up under a single parent Acme account. Maybe the Acme East and Acme West child accounts have different entitled prices for certain products than the Acme parent account.

RECORD	ACME PARENT ACCOUNT	ACME EAST CHILD ACCOUNT	ACME WEST CHILD ACCOUNT
Account Group	Acme Account Group	Acme East Account Group	Acme West Account Group
Price List	Acme Price List	Acme East Price List	Acme West Price List
Price for Product A	$100	$80	$60
Price for Product B	$50	$40	$70

You can allow a contact with Acme to log in to the storefront on behalf of Acme East or Acme West. The contact can:

View products entitled to a selected child account
See prices entitled to a selected child account
Check out using a selected child account's billing and shipping address

To implement the parent-child hierarchy strategy for effective accounts:

Set up the parent account.
On the Accounts tab in your org, edit the record for the parent account.
Assign the parent account to an account group—such as Acme Account Group. Make sure to assign a price list—such as Acme Price List—to that account group.
Add the contact (who's going to purchase on behalf of child accounts) to the parent account.
Set up each child account.
On the Accounts tab in your org, edit the record a child account.
Make sure that the parent account is referenced from the child account's Parent Account field.
Assign the child account to a unique account group—such as Acme West Account Group. Make sure to assign a unique price list—such as Acme West Price List—to that account group.
Create a sharing set so that the contact with the parent account can access data from the child accounts.
NOTE Account data is secure by default: the organization-wide default (OWD) external access for account records is Private. To allow buyers to access data from other accounts, create a sharing set that applies to users with your storefront's user profile. You created this profile before you installed the managed package.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Scroll to the Sharing Sets related list, and click New.
Enter and a label and name for the sharing set, such as Effective Account Sharing Set.
In the Select Profiles section, select your custom storefront user profile and add it to the Selected Profiles list.
In the Select Objects section, add Account to the Selected Objects list.
In the Configure Access section, click Set Up in the Action column for the account object.
In the Access Mapping for Account window, select the following values, and click Update.
FIELD	VALUE
Grant access where: User	Account
Matches: Target Account	Parent
Matches: Access Level	Read Only
NOTE This sharing set specifies that a user with a parent account can access the data of its child accounts. The access level is Read Only because the user is only referencing data from the child account, and isn't modifying any account details.
Click Save.
Update your storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Effective Account (3).
Find the Filter Mode configuration (4), and make sure that its value is ParentHierarchy (5).
TIP
If the configuration has a value other than ParentHierarchy, click Override in the Action column. Enter a ParentHierarchy for Value, and click Create. But, use caution when you override an existing value for this configuration—your org could already be set up to use a different effective accounts strategy.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Effective Account
Configuration	Filter Mode
Page	all
Value	ParentHierarchy
Enable the Effective Account Selector for your storefront, and choose the selector's display mode.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

To validate that your effective account strategy is working correctly, you can:

Browse the storefront and verify a selected effective account's entitled products and prices.
Navigate to the My Account page, which can show the addresses, carts, subscriptions, and more for the selected effective account.
SEE ALSO
Create an Account Group
Create a Price List
Salesforce Help Display Account Hierarchies

Let us know so we can improve!

title: Configuring Parent-Child Hierarchy Strategy for Effective Accounts
